snippet: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn said that Saddiq Al-Abbadi ambushed American convoys in Iraq, and that Ali Alvi fought for the Taliban in Afghanistan where American forces were stationed.
abstract: Yemeni men Saddiq Al-Abbadi and Ali Alvi are arrested in Saudi Arabia and extadited to United states to face charges by federal prosecutors in Brooklyn; are charged with providing material support to Al Qaeda and conspiring to murder United States nationals abroad for activities in Iraq and Afghanistan between 2003 and 2008.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn said that Saddiq Al-Abbadi ambushed American convoys in Iraq, and that Ali Alvi fought for the Taliban in Afghanistan where American forces were stationed.

headline.main: 2 Yemeni Men Are Charged With Conspiring to Attack American Soldiers
headline.print_headline: 2 Yemenis Accused of Having Qaeda Ties
